trans-unit.source: Mozilla.org's XSLT Project Page, which includes a frequently encountered issues section.
XML Path Language from What is XSLT? by G. Ken Holman

XSL Results Firefox extension (presently awaiting review) - allows one to experiment with XSL, by applying XSL stylesheets (which are manually entered, found via a URL or on the file-system) to an XML document (the currently-loaded document or a manually entered/pasted one).

XSLTProcessor.importStylesheet() requires one argument, a DOM Node. If that node is a document node, you can pass in a full XSL Transform or a literal result element transform, otherwise it must be an xsl:stylesheet or xsl:transform element.
XSLTProcessor.transformToDocument() takes one argument, the source node to transform, and returns a new Document with the results of the transformation:

XSLTProcessor.transformToFragment() takes two arguments: the source document to be transformed (as above) and the Document object that will own the fragment (all fragments must be owned by a document).

XSLTProcessor.transformToFragment() will only produce HTML DOM objects if the owner document is itself an HTMLDocument, or if the output method of the stylesheet is HTML. It will not produce an HTML DOM objects if only the toplevel element of the result is <html> as XSLTProcessor.transformToFragment() is rarely used to create this element. If you want to override this, you can set the output method normally in the standard way.
:has() selector
:scope or :host selector

trans-unit.source: XSLT/XPath Reference: XSLT elements, EXSLT functions, XPath functions, XPath axes The following is an annotated list of core XPath functions and XSLT-specific additions to XPath, including a description, syntax, a list of arguments, result-type, source in the appropriate W3C Recommendation, and degree of present Gecko support. For further information on using XPath/XSLT functions, please see the For Further Reading page.
trans-unit.target: XSLT / XPath Referencia : Elementos XSLT , Funciones EXSLT , funciones XPath , XPath ejes La siguiente es una lista anotada de núcleo XPath funciones y XSLT adiciones específicas de a XPath, incluyendo una descripción, la sintaxis, una lista de argumentos, de tipo resultado, fuente en la Recomendación W3C apropiada, y el grado desoporteactual de Gecko . Para más información sobre cómo utilizar las funciones XPath / XSLT, consulte la Lectura adicional página.

trans-unit.source: XSLT/XPath Reference: XSLT elements, EXSLT functions, XPath functions, XPath axes There are thirteen different axes in the XPath specification. An axis represents a relationship to the context node, and is used to locate nodes relative to that node on the tree. The following is an extremely brief description of the thirteen available axes and the degree of support available in Gecko.
trans-unit.target: XSLT / XPath Referencia : Elementos XSLT , Funciones EXSLT , funciones XPath , XPath ejes Hay trece ejes diferentes en el XPath especificación. Un eje representa una relación con el nodo de contexto y se utiliza para ubicar nodos en relación con ese nodo en el árbol. La siguiente es una descripción extremadamente breve de los trece ejes disponibles y el grado de soporte disponible en Gecko .

trans-unit.source: XSLT/XPath Reference: XSLT elements, EXSLT functions, XPath functions, XPath axes
trans-unit.target: Referencia XSLT / XPath : elementos XSLT , funciones EXSLT , funciones XPath , ejes XPath

trans-unit.source: XSLT/XPath Reference: XSLT elements, EXSLT functions, XPath functions, XPath axes There are two types of elements discussed here: top-level elements and instructions. A top-level element must appear as the child of either <xsl:stylesheet> or <xsl:transform>. An instruction, on the other hand, is associated with a template. A stylesheet may include several templates. A third type of element, not discussed here, is the literal result element (LRE). An LRE also appears in a template. It consists of any non-instruction element that should be copied as-is to the result document, for example, an <hr> element in an HTML conversion stylesheet.
trans-unit.target: XSLT / XPath Referencia : Elementos XSLT , Funciones EXSLT , funciones XPath , XPath ejes Hay dos tipos de elementos discutidos aquí: elementos de nivel superior e instrucciones. Un elemento de nivel superior debe aparecer como hijo de <xsl:stylesheet> o <xsl:transform> . Una instrucción, por otro lado, está asociada con una plantilla. Una hoja de estilo puede incluir varias plantillas. Un tercer tipo de elemento, que no se analiza aquí, es el elemento de resultado literal (LRE). Un LRE también aparece en una plantilla. Consiste en cualquier elemento que no sea una instrucción que debe copiarse tal cual en el documento de resultado, por ejemplo, unelemento <hr> en una hoja de estilo de conversión HTML.

trans-unit.source: XSLT/XPath Reference: XSLT elements, EXSLT functions, XPath functions, XPath axes

XSLT/XPath Reference: XSLT elements, EXSLT functions, XPath functions, XPath axes The following is an annotated list of core XPath functions and XSLT-specific additions to XPath, including a description, syntax, a list of arguments, result-type, source in the appropriate W3C Recommendation, and degree of present Gecko support. For further information on using XPath/XSLT functions, please see the For Further Reading page.

XSLT/XPath Reference: XSLT elements, EXSLT functions, XPath functions, XPath axes There are thirteen different axes in the XPath specification. An axis represents a relationship to the context node, and is used to locate nodes relative to that node on the tree. The following is an extremely brief description of the thirteen available axes and the degree of support available in Gecko.

trans-unit.source: contextNode: A node in the document against which the xpathExpression should be evaluated, including any and all of its child nodes. The document node is the most commonly used.

trans-unit.source: namespaceResolver: A function that will be passed any namespace prefixes contained within xpathExpression which returns a string representing the namespace URI associated with that prefix. This enables conversion between the prefixes used in the XPath expressions and the possibly different prefixes used in the document. The function can be either:

null, which can be used for HTML documents or when no namespace prefixes are used. Note that, if the xpathExpression contains a namespace prefix, this will result in a DOMException being thrown with the code NAMESPACE_ERR.
result: If an existing XPathResult object is specified, it will be reused to return the results. Specifying null will create a new XPathResult object.

resultType: A constant that specifies the desired result type to be returned as a result of the evaluation. The most commonly passed constant is XPathResult.ANY_TYPE which will return the results of the XPath expression as the most natural type. There is a section in the appendix which contains a full list of the available constants. They are explained below in the section "Specifying the Return Type."
standalone (Not supported.)
trans-unit.target: standalone (no compatible)

Extensible Stylesheet Language (XSL): http://www.oasis-open.org/cover/xsl.html

Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations (XSLT) is an XML-based language used, in conjunction with specialized processing software, for the transformation of XML documents. Although the process is referred to as "transformation," the original document is not changed; rather, a new XML document is created based on the content of an existing document. Then, the new document may be serialized (output) by the processor in standard XML syntax or in another format, such as HTML or plain text. XSLT is most often used to convert data between different XML schemas or to convert XML data into web pages or PDF documents. [one]
trans-unit.target: Transformaciones de lenguaje de hoja de estilo extensible (XSLT) es un lenguaje basado en XML que se utiliza, junto con software de procesamiento especializado, para la transformación de documentos XML. Aunque el proceso se denomina "transformación", el documento original no se modifica; más bien, se crea un nuevo documento XML basado en el contenido de un documento existente. Luego, el procesador puede serializar (generar) el nuevo documento en sintaxis XML estándar o en otro formato, como HTML o texto sin formato. XSLT se utiliza con mayor frecuencia para convertir datos entre diferentes esquemas XML o para convertir datos XML en páginas web o documentos PDF. [uno]

JXON (lossless JavaScript XML Object Notation) is a generic name by which is defined the representation of JavaScript Objects using XML. There are some cases in which the whole content of an XML document must be read from the JavaScript interpreter (like for web-apps languages or settings XML documents, for example). In these cases JXON could represent the most practical way and a valid alternative to XPath.
trans-unit.target: JXON (sin pérdida J avascript X ML O bject N flotación) es un nombre genérico por el cual se define la representación de JavaScript objetos usando XML . Hay algunos casos en los que todo el contenido de un documento XML debe leerse desde el intérprete de JavaScript (como para los lenguajes de aplicaciones web o documentos XML de configuración, por ejemplo). En estos casos, JXON podría representar la forma más práctica y una alternativa válida a XPath.

trans-unit.source: A node's language is determined by its xml:lang attribute. If the current node does not have an xml:lang attribute, then the value of the xml:lang attribute of the nearest ancestor that has an xml:lang attribute will determine the current node's language. Si no se puede determinar el idioma (ningún antepasado tiene un atributo xml:lang ), esta función devolverá falso.

Another approach to match default elements in a non-null namespace (and one which works well for dynamic XPath expressions where the namespaces might not be known), involves referring to a particular element using a form such as [namespace-uri()='http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml' and name()='p' and @id='_myid']. This circumvents the problem of an XPath query not being able to detect the default namespace on a regularly labeled element.

trans-unit.source: At present, Gecko (the layout engine behind Firefox) supports two forms of XML stylesheets. For basic control of appearance — fonts, colors, position, and so forth — Gecko uses CSS. CSS1 and CSS2 are well supported and support for the emerging CSS3 standard is under development. For further information about CSS, see Eric Meyer's CSS pages.

At the top of the tree is the root node. The root node does not correspond to any individual part of the XML document: it represents the document as whole. Below the root node are its children, which can be elements, comments, processing instructions and so on. Some of those children may also have children. And this can continue for several levels. There are certain constraints on which type of nodes can occur where: for example, text nodes can have no children.

trans-unit.source: For the actual transformation, XSLTProcessor requires an XML document, which is used in conjunction with the imported XSL file to produce the final result. The XML document can be a separate XML file loaded as shown in figure 1, or it can be part of the existing page. To process part of a page's DOM, it is necessary to first create an XML document in memory. Assuming that the DOM to be processed is contained by an element with the id example, that DOM can be "cloned" using the in-memory XML document's Document.importNode() method. Document.importNode() allows transferring a DOM fragment between documents, in this case from an HTML document to an XML document. The first parameter references the DOM node to clone. By making the second parameter "true", it will clone all descendants as well (a deep clone). The cloned DOM can then be easily inserted into the XML document using Node.appendChild(), as shown in figure 2.

trans-unit.source: In essence, an XSLT stylesheet is a set of rules, called templates, which declare that any node that matches this specific pattern should be manipulated in this specific way and end up in this specific position in the result tree. The particulars of how this is to be accomplished are left up to the processor. Because the order of execution of the stylesheet cannot be guaranteed, XSLT does not support any functionality that produces side-effects. In this it is like Lisp or Scheme.

In general, a more specific template rule takes precedence over a less specific one and, other things being equal, a template rule that appears later in the document takes precedence over one that appears earlier.

trans-unit.source: Namespaces are the subject of a fair amount of confusion in XML. Despite the fact that very often namespaces appear to be URIs, they do not, in fact, refer to a resource located at that address. Instead they are simply a way of specifying a unique identifier for a known set of elements. The string "http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" is a constant that designates the elements so marked as belonging to the set of tags designated by the W3C in the 1999 XSLT Recommendation. Another string that is occasionally seen in stylesheets, "http://www.w3.org/TR/WD-xsl", indicates compliance with an earlier working draft (hence the WD) of the W3C document. This latter namespace is not compatible with the one that the W3C eventually adopted and is not supported by Netscape.

Note: This reprinted article was originally part of the DevEdge site.

Note: XPath defines QNames without a prefix to match only elements in the null namespace. There is no way in XPath to pick up the default namespace as applied to a regular element reference (e.g., p[@id='_myid'] for xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml'). To match default elements in a non-null namespace, you either have to refer to a particular element using a form such as ['namespace-uri()='http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml' and name()='p' and @id='_myid'] (this approach works well for dynamic XPath's where the namespaces might not be known) or use prefixed name tests, and create a namespace resolver mapping the prefix to the namespace. Read more on how to create a user-defined namespace resolver, if you wish to take the latter approach.

Numbers all matching nodes, regardless of level, sequentially. The ancestor, self, and preceding axes are all considered. The processor starts at the current node and proceeds in reverse document order, stopping if it reaches a match to any from attribute. If no match to the count attribute is found, the sequence will be an empty list. This level is not supported at this time.
trans-unit.target: Numera todos los nodos coincidentes, independientemente del nivel, de forma secuencial. El ancestor , el self y preceding ejes precedentes se consideran todos. El procesador comienza en el nodo actual y procede en orden de documento inversa, parando si alcanza un partido a cualquier from atributo. Si no se encuentra ninguna coincidencia con el atributo de count , la secuencia será una lista vacía. Este nivel no es compatible en este momento.

trans-unit.source: Numbers nodes as a composite sequence that reflects the hierarchic position of the node, e.g. 1.2.2.5. (The nested format can be specified with the format attribute, e.g. A.1.1). The processor looks at all ancestors of the current node and the current node itself, stopping when it reaches a match for the from attribute, if there is one. For each node in this list that matches the count attribute, the processor counts how many preceding matching siblings it has, and adds one for the node itself. If no match is found, the sequence will be an empty list.
trans-unit.target: Numera los nodos como una secuencia compuesta que refleja la posición jerárquica del nodo, por ejemplo, 1.2.2.5. (El formato anidado se puede especificar con el atributo de format o , por ejemplo, A.1.1). El procesador mira todos los ancestors del nodo actual y el nodo actual en sí, deteniéndose cuando alcanza una coincidencia para el atributo from , si existe. Para cada nodo de esta lista que coincida con el atributo de count , el procesador cuenta cuántos hermanos coincidentes anteriores tiene y agrega uno para el nodo en sí. Si no se encuentra ninguna coincidencia, la secuencia será una lista vacía.

trans-unit.source: Numbers sibling nodes sequentially, as in the items in a list. The processor goes to the first node in the ancestor-or-self axis that matches the count attribute and then counts that node plus all its preceding siblings (stopping when it reaches a match to the from attribute, if there is one) that also match the count attribute.If no match is found, the sequence will be an empty list.
trans-unit.target: Numera los nodos hermanos de forma secuencial, como en los elementos de una lista. El procesador pasa al primer nodo en el ancestor-or-self eje que coincide con el count atributo y cuenta entonces que el nodo más todos sus hermanos anteriores (se detiene cuando alcanza una coincidencia con el from atributo, si hay uno) que también coincide el atributo de count no se encuentra ninguna coincidencia, la secuencia será una lista vacía.

Una plantilla de valor de atributo es simplemente una cadena que incluye una expresión XPath incrustada que se utiliza para especificar el valor de un atributo. En el tiempo de ejecución, la expresión se evalúa y el resultado de la evaluación se sustituye por la expresión XPath. trans-unit.source: Once the stylesheet has been imported, XSLTProcessor has to perform two methods for the actual transformation, namely XSLTProcessor.transformToDocument() and XSLTProcessor.transformToFragment(). XSLTProcessor.transformToDocument() returns a full XML document while XSLTProcessor.transformToFragment() returns a document fragment that can be easily added to an existing document. Both take in the XML document as the first parameter that will be transformed. XSLTProcessor.transformToFragment() requires a second parameter, namely the document object that will own the generated fragment. If the generated fragment will be inserted into the current HTML document, passing in document is enough.

Our focus here is on the second type of stylesheet that Gecko supports: the XSLT stylesheet. XSLT stands for eXtensible Stylesheet Language/Transform and the name is apt. XSLT allows a stylesheet author to transform a primary XML document in two significant ways: manipulating and sorting the content, including a wholesale reordering of it if so desired, and transforming the content into a different format (and in the case of Firefox, the focus is on converting it on the fly into HTML which can then be displayed by the browser).

trans-unit.source: Strings are converted to a number by stripping the leading whitespace in the string before the number and ignoring whitespace after the number. If the string does not match this pattern, then the string is converted to NaN.
trans-unit.target: Las cuerdas se convierten en un nmero quitando el espacio blanco principal de la cuerda antes del nmero e ignorando el espacio blanco despus del nmero.Si la cadena no coincide con este patrn,entonces la cadena se convierte en NaN.

trans-unit.source: Stylesheets can be attached to an XML document via a processing instruction.
Subinstruction, always appears as a child of <xsl:for-each>, where it must appear before the template proper or of <xsl:apply-templates>.
trans-unit.target: Subinstrucción, siempre aparece como hijo de <xsl: for-each>, donde debe aparecer antes de la plantilla propiamente dicha o de <xsl: apply-templates>.

trans-unit.source: Subinstruction, always appears within an <xsl:apply-templates> or an <xsl:call-template> element.
trans-unit.target: Subinstrucción, siempre aparece dentro de un elemento <xsl:apply-templates> o <xsl:call-template> .

trans-unit.source: Subinstruction, always appears within an <xsl:choose> element.
trans-unit.target: Subinstrucción, siempre aparece dentro de un elemento <xsl:choose> .

trans-unit.source: Subinstruction, must appear as the last child of an <xsl:choose> element, within a template.
trans-unit.target: Subinstrucción, debe aparecer como el último hijo de un elemento <xsl:choose> , dentro de una plantilla.

trans-unit.source: Subnav
trans-unit.target: Subnav

trans-unit.target: Supported

trans-unit.source: Supported as noted.
trans-unit.target: Apoyado como se ha sealado.

trans-unit.source: Supported as of 1.0 (Mozilla 1.0, Netscape 7.0).
trans-unit.target: Soportado desde 1.0 (Mozilla 1.0,Netscape 7.0).

trans-unit.source: Supported as of Firefox 2.0.0.1. The value attribute is supported in Firefox 2, but the select attribute crashes for some expressions in the 2.0 release.
trans-unit.target: Compatible a partir de Firefox 2.0.0.1. El atributo de valor es compatible con Firefox 2, pero el atributo de selección falla para algunas expresiones en la versión 2.0.

trans-unit.source: Supported as of Firefox 2.0.0.1. The value attribute is supported in Firefox 2, but the select attribute crashes for some expressions in the 2.0 release.
Supported except as above.

trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Tags and summary
The QName is the node's qualified name, including its namespace prefix and its local name.
trans-unit.target: El QName es el nombre calificado del nodo, incluido su prefijo de espacio de nombres y su nombre local.

trans-unit.source: The evaluate function takes a total of five parameters:

The XSLTProcessor object also implements a XSLTProcessor.reset() method, which can be used to remove all stylesheets and parameters then put the processor back into its initial state. This method is implemented in Mozilla 1.3 and later.

The <xsl:apply-imports> element is fairly arcane, used mostly in complex stylesheets. Import precedence requires that template rules in main stylesheets have higher precedence than template rules in imported stylesheets. Sometimes, however, it is useful to be able to force the processor to use a template rule from the (lower precedence) imported stylesheet rather than an equivalent rule in the main stylesheet.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:apply-imports> es bastante arcano, y se usa principalmente en hojas de estilo complejas. La precedencia de la importación requiere que las reglas de la plantilla en las hojas de estilo principales tengan mayor precedencia que las reglas de la plantilla en las hojas de estilo importadas. A veces, sin embargo, es útil poder forzar al procesador a usar una regla de plantilla de la hoja de estilo importada (de menor prioridad) en lugar de una regla equivalente en la hoja de estilo principal.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:apply-templates> element selects a set of nodes in the input tree and instructs the processor to apply the proper templates to them.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:apply-templates> selecciona un conjunto de nodos en el árbol de entrada e indica al procesador que les aplique las plantillas adecuadas.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:attribute> element creates an attribute in the output document, using any values that can be accessed from the stylesheet. The element must be defined before any other output document element inside the output document element for which it establishes attribute values. But it may be after or inside elements that won't be part of the output (like <xsl:choose> or <xsl:apply-templates> etc.).
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:attribute> crea un atributo en el documento de salida, utilizando cualquier valor al que se pueda acceder desde la hoja de estilo. El elemento debe definirse antes que cualquier otro elemento de documento de salida dentro del elemento de documento de salida para el que establece valores de atributo. Pero pueden ser elementos posteriores o internos que no serán parte de la salida (como <xsl:choose> o <xsl:apply-templates> , etc.).

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:attribute-set> element creates a named set of attributes, which can then be applied as whole to the output document, in a manner similar to named styles in CSS.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:attribute-set> crea un conjunto de atributos con nombre, que luego se puede aplicar en su totalidad al documento de salida, de manera similar a los estilos con nombre en CSS.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:call-template> element invokes a named template.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:call-template> invoca una plantilla con nombre.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:choose> element defines a choice among a number of alternatives. It behaves like a switch statement in procedural languages.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:choose> define una elección entre varias alternativas. Se comporta como una instrucción de cambio en lenguajes de procedimiento.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:comment> element writes a comment to the output document. It must include only text.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:comment> escribe un comentario en el documento de salida. Debe incluir solo texto.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:copy> element transfers a shallow copy (the node and any associated namespace node) of the current node to the output document. It does not copy any children or attributes of the current node.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:copy> transfiere una copia superficial (el nodo y cualquier nodo de espacio de nombres asociado) del nodo actual al documento de salida. No copia ningún hijo o atributo del nodo actual.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:copy-of> element makes a deep copy (including descendant nodes) of whatever the select attribute specifies to the output document.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:copy-of> hace una copia profunda (incluidos los nodos descendientes) de lo que sea que el atributo select especifique en el documento de salida.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:decimal-format> element defines the characters and symbols that are to be used in converting numbers into strings using the
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:decimal-format> define los caracteres y símbolos que se utilizarán para convertir números en cadenas utilizando la

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:decimal-format> element defines the characters and symbols that are to be used in converting numbers into strings using theformat-number( ) function.
The <xsl:element> element creates an element in the output document.
trans-unit.target: El <xsl:element> crea un elemento en el documento de salida.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:fallback> element specifies what template to use if a given extension (or, eventually, newer version) element is not supported.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:fallback> especifica qué plantilla usar si una extensión determinada (o, eventualmente, una versión más reciente) no es compatible.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:for-each> element selects a set of nodes and processes each of them in the same way. It is often used to iterate through a set of nodes or to change the current node. If one or more <xsl:sort> elements appear as the children of this element, sorting occurs before processing. Otherwise, nodes are processed in document order.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:for-each> selecciona un conjunto de nodos y procesa cada uno de ellos de la misma manera. A menudo se usa para iterar a través de un conjunto de nodos o para cambiar el nodo actual. Si uno o más elementos <xsl:sort> aparecen como hijos de este elemento, la ordenación ocurre antes del procesamiento. De lo contrario, los nodos se procesan en el orden del documento.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:if> element contains a test attribute and a template. If the test evaluates to true, the template is processed. In this it is similar to an if statement in other languages. To achieve the functionality of an <tt>if-then-else</tt> statement, however, use the <xsl:choose> element with one <xsl:when> and one <xsl:otherwise> children.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:if> contiene un atributo de prueba y una plantilla. Si la prueba se evalúa como verdadera, se procesa la plantilla. En esto es similar a una declaración if en otros idiomas. Sin embargo, para lograr la funcionalidad de una instrucción <tt> if-then-else </tt>, use el elemento <xsl:choose> con un <xsl:when> y un <xsl:otherwise> hijos.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:if> element contains a test attribute and a template. If the test evaluates to true, the template is processed. In this it is similar to an if statement in other languages. To achieve the functionality of an if-then-else statement, however, use the <xsl:choose> element with one <xsl:when> and one <xsl:otherwise> children.

The <xsl:import> element is a top-level element that serves to import the contents of one stylesheet into another stylesheet. Generally speaking, the contents of the imported stylesheet have a lower import precedence than that of the importing stylesheet. This is in contrast to <xsl:include> where the contents of the included stylesheet have exactly the same precedence as the contents of the including stylesheet.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:import> es un elemento de nivel superior que sirve para importar el contenido de una hoja de estilo a otra hoja de estilo. En términos generales, el contenido de la hoja de estilo importada tiene una precedencia de importación menor que el de la hoja de estilo importada. Esto contrasta con <xsl:include> donde el contenido de la hoja de estilo incluida tiene exactamente la misma precedencia que el contenido de la hoja de estilo incluida.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:include> element merges the contents of one stylesheet with another. Unlike the case of <xsl:import>, the contents of an included stylesheet have exactly the same precedence as the contents of the including stylesheet.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:include> fusiona el contenido de una hoja de estilo con otra. A diferencia del caso de <xsl:import> , el contenido de una hoja de estilo incluida tiene exactamente la misma precedencia que el contenido de la hoja de estilo incluida.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:key> element declares a named key which can be used elsewhere in the stylesheet with the key( ) function.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:key> declara una clave con nombre que se puede usar en cualquier otro lugar de la hoja de estilo con la función key( ) .

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:message> element outputs a message (to the JavaScript Console in NS) and optionally terminates execution of the stylesheet. It can be useful for debugging.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:message> envía un mensaje (a la consola JavaScript en NS) y opcionalmente finaliza la ejecución de la hoja de estilo. Puede ser útil para depurar.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:namespace-alias> element is a rarely used device that maps a namespace in the stylesheet to a different namespace in the output tree. The most common use for this element is in generating a stylesheet from another stylesheet. To prevent a normally xsl:-prefixed literal result element (which should simply be copied as-is to the result tree) from being misunderstood by the processor, it is assigned a temporary namespace which is appropriately re-converted back to the XSLT namespace in the output tree.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:namespace-alias> es un dispositivo de uso poco frecuente que asigna un espacio de nombres en la hoja de estilo a un espacio de nombres diferente en el árbol de salida. El uso más común de este elemento es generar una hoja de estilo a partir de otra hoja de estilo. Para evitar que un elemento de resultado literal normalmente xsl: -prefixed (que simplemente debe copiarse tal cual en el árbol de resultados) sea malinterpretado por el procesador, se le asigna un espacio de nombres temporal que se vuelve a convertir apropiadamente al espacio de nombres XSLT en el árbol de salida.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:namespace-alias> element.
The <xsl:number> element counts things sequentially. It can also be used to quickly format a number.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:number> cuenta las cosas de forma secuencial. También se puede utilizar para formatear rápidamente un número.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:otherwise> element is used to define the action that should be taken when none of the <xsl:when> conditions apply. It is similar to the else or default case in other programing languages.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:otherwise> se usa para definir la acción que se debe tomar cuando no se aplica ninguna de las condiciones <xsl:when> . Es similar al caso else o default en otros lenguajes de programación.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:output> element controls the characteristics of the output document. To function correctly in Netscape, this element, with the method attribute, must be used. As of 7.0, method="text" works as expected.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:output> controla las características del documento de salida. Para funcionar correctamente en Netscape, se debe utilizar este elemento, con el atributo de método. A partir de la versión 7.0, method="text" funciona como se esperaba.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:param> element establishes a parameter by name and, optionally, a default value for that parameter. When used as a top-level element, the parameter is global . When used inside an <xsl:template> element, the parameter is local to that template. In this case it must be the first child element of the template.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:param> establece un parámetro por nombre y, opcionalmente, un valor predeterminado para ese parámetro. Cuando se utiliza como elemento de nivel superior, el parámetro es global. Cuando se usa dentro de un elemento <xsl:template> , el parámetro es local para esa plantilla. En este caso, debe ser el primer elemento secundario de la plantilla.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:preserve-space> element defines the elements in the source document for which whitespace should be preserved. If there is more than one element, separate the names with a whitespace character. Preserving whitespace is the default setting, so this element only needs to be used to counteract an <xsl:strip-space> element.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:preserve-space> define los elementos del documento fuente para los que se deben conservar los espacios en blanco. Si hay más de un elemento, separe los nombres con un carácter de espacio en blanco. La preservación de los espacios en blanco es la configuración predeterminada, por lo que este elemento solo debe usarse para contrarrestar un elemento <xsl:strip-space> .

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:processing-instruction> element writes a processing instruction to the output document.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:processing-instruction> escribe una instrucción de procesamiento en el documento de salida.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:strip-space> element defines the elements in the source document for which whitespace should be removed.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:strip-space> define los elementos del documento de origen para los que se deben eliminar los espacios en blanco.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:stylesheet> element (or the equivalent <xsl:transform> element) is the outermost element of a stylesheet.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:stylesheet> (o el elemento <xsl:transform> equivalente ) es el elemento más externo de una hoja de estilo.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:template> element defines an output producing template. This element must have either the match attribute or the name attribute set.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:template> define una plantilla de producción de salida. Este elemento debe tener el atributo de coincidencia o el atributo de nombre establecido.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:text> element writes literal text to the output tree. It may contain #PCDATA, literal text, and entity references.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:text> escribe texto literal en el árbol de salida. Puede contener #PCDATA , texto literal y referencias a entidades.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:transform> element is exactly equivalent to the <xsl:stylesheet> element.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:transform> es exactamente equivalente al elemento <xsl:stylesheet> .

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:value-of> element evaluates an XPath expression, converts it to a string, and writes that string to the result tree.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:value-of> evalúa una expresión XPath, la convierte en una cadena y escribe esa cadena en el árbol de resultados.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:variable> element declares a global or local variable in a stylesheet and gives it a value. Because XSLT permits no side-effects, once the value of the variable has been established, it remains the same until the variable goes out of scope
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:variable> declara una variable global o local en una hoja de estilo y le da un valor. Debido a que XSLT no permite efectos secundarios, una vez que se ha establecido el valor de la variable, permanece igual hasta que la variable sale del alcance.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:when> element always appears within an <xsl:choose> element, acting like a case statement.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:when> siempre aparece dentro de un elemento <xsl:choose> , actuando como una declaración de caso.

trans-unit.source: The <xsl:with-param> element sets the value of a parameter to be passed into a template.
trans-unit.target: El elemento <xsl:with-param> establece el valor de un parámetro que se pasará a una plantilla.

trans-unit.source: The xsl:key element defines what attribute on what given elements will be used to match the key.
trans-unit.target: El elemento xsl:key define qué atributo de qué elementos dados se utilizarán para hacer coincidir la clave.

trans-unit.source: The XPathResult object allows node-sets to be returned in 3 principal different types:

The XPathResult object returned is a node-set of matched nodes which will behave as an iterator, allowing us to access the individual nodes contained by using the iterateNext() method of the XPathResult.

The XPathResult object returned is a static node-set of matched nodes, which allows us to access each node through the snapshotItem(itemNumber) method of the XPathResult object, where itemNumber is the index of the node to be retrieved. The total number of nodes contained can be accessed through the snapshotLength property.

The XPathResult object returned is only the first found node that matched the XPath expression. This can be accessed through the singleNodeValue property of the XPathResult object. This will be null if the node set is empty.
The ancestor-or-self axis indicates the context node and all of its ancestors, including the root node.
trans-unit.target: El eje ancestor-or-self indica el nodo de contexto y todos sus antepasados, incluido el nodo raíz.

trans-unit.source: The ancestor axis indicates all the ancestors of the context node beginning with the parent node and traveling through to the root node.
trans-unit.target: El eje del ancestor indica todos los ancestros del nodo de contexto comenzando con el nodo padre y viajando hasta el nodo raíz.

trans-unit.source: The attribute axis indicates the attributes of the context node. Only elements have attributes. This axis can be abbreviated with the at sign (@).
trans-unit.target: El eje de attribute indica los atributos del nodo de contexto. Solo los elementos tienen atributos. Este eje se puede abreviar con el signo arroba ( @ ).

trans-unit.source: The boolean function evaluates an expression and returns true or false.
trans-unit.target: La función boolean a evalúa una expresión y devuelve verdadero o falso.

trans-unit.source: The ceiling function evaluates a decimal number and returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to the decimal number.
trans-unit.target: La función de ceiling evalúa un número decimal y devuelve el entero más pequeño mayor o igual que el número decimal.

trans-unit.source: The child axis indicates the children of the context node. If an XPath expression does not specify an axis, the child axis is understood by default. Since only the root node or element nodes have children, any other use will select nothing.
trans-unit.target: El eje child indica los hijos del nodo de contexto. Si una expresión XPath no especifica un eje, el eje child se entiende por defecto. Dado que solo el nodo raíz o los nodos de elemento tienen hijos, cualquier otro uso no seleccionará nada.

trans-unit.source: The choose function returns one of the specified objects based on a boolean parameter.
trans-unit.target: La función de choose devuelve uno de los objetos especificados en función de un parámetro booleano.

trans-unit.source: The concat function concatenates two or more strings and returns the resulting string.
trans-unit.target: La función concat concatena dos o más cadenas y devuelve la cadena resultante.

trans-unit.source: The contains function determines whether the first argument string contains the second argument string and returns boolean true or false.
trans-unit.target: La función contains determina si la primera cadena de argumento contiene la segunda cadena de argumento y devuelve booleano verdadero o falso.

trans-unit.source: The count function counts the number of nodes in a node-set and returns an integer.
trans-unit.target: La función de count cuenta el número de nodos en un conjunto de nodos y devuelve un número entero.

trans-unit.source: The current function can be used to get the context node in an XSLT instruction.
trans-unit.target: La función current se puede utilizar para obtener el nodo de contexto en una instrucción XSLT.

trans-unit.source: The descendant-or-self axis indicates the context node and all of its descendants. Attribute and namespace nodes are not included - the parent of an attribute node is an element node, but attribute nodes are not the children of their parents.
trans-unit.target: El eje descendant-or-self indica el nodo de contexto y todos sus descendientes. Los nodos de atributo y espacio de nombres no están incluidos: el parent de un nodo de attribute es un nodo de elemento, pero los nodos de attribute no son los hijos de sus padres.

trans-unit.source: The descendant-or-self axis indicates the context node and all of its descendants. Attribute and namespace nodes are not included - the parent of an attribute node is an element node, but attribute nodes are not the children of their parents.

The descendant axis indicates all of the children of the context node, and all of their children, and so forth. Attribute and namespace nodes are not included - the parent of an attribute node is an element node, but attribute nodes are not the children of their parents.
trans-unit.target: El eje descendant indica todos los elementos secundarios del nodo de contexto y todos sus elementos secundarios, etc. Los nodos de atributo y espacio de nombres no están incluidos: el parent de un nodo de attribute es un nodo de elemento, pero los nodos de attribute no son los hijos de sus padres.

trans-unit.source: The descendant axis indicates all of the children of the context node, and all of their children, and so forth. Attribute and namespace nodes are not included - the parent of an attribute node is an element node, but attribute nodes are not the children of their parents.

The disable-output-escaping attribute. This feature controls how serializing the constructed output document works. However Firefox never serializes the output document and so the attribute isn't really applicable. While we could try to add some heuristics to serialize and reparse just the part of the output document which has disable-output-escaping applied, heuristics often get things wrong and lead to surprising results, hence we've been reluctant to add this so far. Often times stylesheets contain code like <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="yes"> </xsl:text>, this is equivalent to simply putting   in the stylesheet which will work great in all XSLT engines. We do realize that the lack of disable-output-escaping is a problem and we'd like to find a solution for it, however so far we haven't found any good solutions.
The document finds a node-set in an external document, or multiple external documents, and returns the resulting node-set.
trans-unit.target: El document o busca un conjunto de nodos en un documento externo, o varios documentos externos, y devuelve el conjunto de nodos resultante.

trans-unit.source: The element-available function determines if an element is available and returns true or false.
trans-unit.target: La función de element-available determina si un elemento está disponible y devuelve verdadero o falso.

trans-unit.source: The false function returns boolean false.
trans-unit.target: La función false devuelve un valor booleano falso.

trans-unit.source: The floor function evaluates a decimal number and returns the largest integer less than or equal to the decimal number.
trans-unit.target: La función de floor evalúa un número decimal y devuelve el mayor entero menor o igual que el número decimal.

trans-unit.source: The following-sibling axis indicates all the nodes that have the same parent as the context node and appear after the context node in the source document.
trans-unit.target: El eje de following-sibling indica todos los nodos que tienen el mismo padre que el nodo de contexto y aparecen después del nodo de contexto en el documento de origen.

trans-unit.source: The following axis indicates all the nodes that appear after the context node, except any descendant, attribute, and namespace nodes.
trans-unit.target: El following eje indica todos los nodos que aparecen después del nodo de contexto, excepto los nodos descendant , de attribute y de namespace .

trans-unit.source: The format-number function evaluates a number and returns a string representing the number in a given format.
trans-unit.target: La función format-number evalúa un número y devuelve una cadena que representa el número en un formato determinado.

trans-unit.source: The function-available function determines if a given function is available and returns boolean true or false.
trans-unit.target: La function-available determina si una función determinada está disponible y devuelve un valor booleano verdadero o falso.

trans-unit.source: The generate-id function generates a unique id for the first node in a given node-set and returns a string containing that id.
trans-unit.target: La función generate-id genera una identificación única para el primer nodo en un conjunto de nodos dado y devuelve una cadena que contiene esa identificación.

trans-unit.source: The id function finds nodes matching the given ids and returns a node-set containing the identified nodes.
trans-unit.target: La función id busca nodos que coincidan con los identificadores dados y devuelve un conjunto de nodos que contiene los nodos identificados.

trans-unit.source: The key function returns a node-set of nodes that have the given value for the given key.
trans-unit.target: La función de key devuelve un conjunto de nodos de nodos que tienen el valor dado para la clave dada.

trans-unit.source: The lang function determines whether the context node matches the given language and returns boolean true or false.
trans-unit.target: La función lang determina si el nodo de contexto coincide con el idioma dado y devuelve booleano verdadero o falso.

trans-unit.source: The last function returns a number equal to the context size from the expression evaluation context.
trans-unit.target: La last función devuelve un número igual al tamaño del contexto del contexto de evaluación de la expresión.

trans-unit.source: The local-name function returns a string representing the local name of the first node in a given node-set.
trans-unit.target: La función de local-name devuelve una cadena que representa el nombre local del primer nodo en un conjunto de nodos dado.

trans-unit.source: The name function returns a string representing the QName of the first node in a given node-set.
trans-unit.target: La función de name devuelve una cadena que representa el QName del primer nodo en un conjunto de nodos dado.

trans-unit.source: The namespace-uri function returns a string representing the namespace URI of the first node in a given node-set.
trans-unit.target: La función namespace-uri devuelve una cadena que representa el URI del espacio de nombres del primer nodo en un conjunto de nodos dado.

trans-unit.source: The namespace:: axis in XPath expressions. Support for this will hopefully be available in the future.
The namespace axis indicates all the nodes that are in scope for the context node. In this case, the context node must be an element node.
trans-unit.target: El eje del namespace indica todos los nodos que están dentro del alcance del nodo de contexto. En este caso, el nodo de contexto debe ser un nodo de elemento.

trans-unit.source: The normalize-space function strips leading and trailing white-space from a string, replaces sequences of whitespace characters by a single space, and returns the resulting string.
trans-unit.target: La función de normalize-space quita los espacios en blanco iniciales y finales de una cadena, reemplaza las secuencias de caracteres de espacio en blanco por un solo espacio y devuelve la cadena resultante.

trans-unit.source: The not function evaluates a boolean expression and returns the opposite value.
trans-unit.target: La función not evalúa una expresión booleana y devuelve el valor opuesto.

trans-unit.source: The number function converts an object to a number and returns the number.
trans-unit.target: La función number convierte un objeto en un número y devuelve el número.

trans-unit.source: The parent axis indicates the single node that is the parent of the context node. It can be abbreviated as two periods (..).
trans-unit.target: El eje parent indica el nodo único que es el principal del nodo de contexto. Se puede abreviar como dos puntos ( .. ).

trans-unit.source: The position function returns a number equal to the context position from the expression evaluation context.
trans-unit.target: La función de position devuelve un número igual a la posición del contexto del contexto de evaluación de la expresión.

trans-unit.source: The preceding-sibling axis indicates all the nodes that have the same parent as the context node and appear before the context node in the source document.
trans-unit.target: El eje del preceding-sibling indica todos los nodos que tienen el mismo padre que el nodo de contexto y aparecen antes del nodo de contexto en el documento de origen.

trans-unit.source: The preceding axis indicates all the nodes that precede the context node in the document except any ancestor, attribute and namespace nodes.
trans-unit.target: El eje preceding indica todos los nodos que preceden al nodo de contexto en el documento, excepto los nodos de ancestor , attribute y namespace .

trans-unit.source: The round function returns a number that is the nearest integer to the given number.
trans-unit.target: La función round devuelve un número que es el entero más cercano al número dado.

trans-unit.source: The self axis indicates the context node itself. It can be abbreviated as a single period (.).
trans-unit.target: El self eje indica el nodo de contexto en sí. Puede abreviarse como un solo punto ( . ).

trans-unit.source: The starts-with checks whether the first string starts with the second string and returns true or false.

trans-unit.source: The string-length function returns a number equal to the number of characters in a given string.

trans-unit.source: The string function converts the given argument to a string.
trans-unit.target: La función de string convierte el argumento dado en una cadena.

trans-unit.source: The substring-after function returns a string that is the rest of a given string after a given substring.
trans-unit.target: La función substring-after devuelve una cadena que es el resto de una cadena dada después de una subcadena dada.

trans-unit.source: The substring-before function returns a string that is the part of a given string before a given substring.

trans-unit.target: La función substring-before devuelve una cadena que es el resto de una cadena dada antes de una subcadena dada.

trans-unit.source: The substring function returns a part of a given string.

trans-unit.source: The system-property function returns an object representing the given system-property.

trans-unit.source: The World Wide Web Consortium
The World Wide Web Consortium is the body that publishes Recommendations for a number of web-based technologies, many of which become the de-facto standard.
The XSL-List is a very active general mailing list, hosted by Mulberry Technologies

The XSLT 1.0 namespace is http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform. Older versions of IE used a different namespace. However these versions also used a draft version of XSLT which is incompatible with what eventually became the XSLT 1.0 specification. Firefox only supports the official XSLT 1.0 version.
The XSLT JavaScript Interface in Gecko

The XSLT file has a parameter called myOrder that JavaScript sets to change the sorting method. The xsl:sort element's order attribute can access the value of the parameter using $myOrder. However, the value needs to be an XPATH expression and not a string, so {$myOrder} is used. Using {} evaluates the content as an XPath expression.

The XSLT transformation engine, called the processor, does not work directly on documents. Before transformation can take place, the primary XML document(s) and the stylesheet document(s) must be run through a parser, which creates an abstract representation of the structure of the document in memory. This representation, called the tree, is what is actually manipulated by the processor. The tree is an abstract datatype, a conceptual model which can be implemented in various ways depending on the parser and the processor. :Netscape's uses a structure similar to the W3C DOM as its tree structure, but others are possible. The only requirements concern the disposition of objects in the tree, their properties, and their relationships.
The XSLT/JavaScript Interface in Gecko

The attributes in the xslt-param and xslt-param-namespace PIs are parsed using the rules defined in xml-stylesheet. Any unrecognized attributes must be ignored. Parsing of any attribute must not fail due to the presence of an unrecognized attribute as long as that attribute follows the syntax in xml-stylesheet.
trans-unit.target: Los atributos de los xslt-param y xslt-param-namespace se analizan utilizando las reglas definidas en xml-stylesheet . Se deben ignorar todos los atributos no reconocidos. El análisis de cualquier atributo no debe fallar debido a la presencia de un atributo no reconocido siempre que ese atributo siga la sintaxis xml-stylesheet .
